sentence.value: Vladimír Remek (born 26 September 1948 in ?eské Bud?jovice, Czechoslovakia) is a Czech politican, diplomat and sales representative, and a former cosmonaut and military pilot.
sentence.annotated-sentence: [[Vladimír Remek|Vladim%C3%ADr_Remek]] (born 26 [[September|September]] [[1948|1948]] in [[?eské Bud?jovice|%C4%8Cesk%C3%A9_Bud%C4%9Bjovice]], [[Czechoslovakia|Czechoslovakia]]) is a [[Czech|Czech_Republic]] [[politican|Politician]], diplomat and sales representative, and a former cosmonaut and [[military pilot|Pilot_(aircraft)]].

sentence.value: He is the first Czechoslovak in space and the first cosmonaut from a country other than the Soviet Union or the United States.
sentence.annotated-sentence: He is the first Czechoslovak in [[space|Space]] and the first cosmonaut from [[a country|Country]] other than [[the Soviet Union|Soviet_Union]] or [[the United States|United_States]].

sentence.value: As of 2004, with the entry of the Czech Republic into the European Union Vladimír Remek is considered to be the first astronaut from the EU.

sentence.value: He flew aboard Soyuz 28 from March 2 to March 10, 1978, for seven days, 22 hours, and 17 minutes.

sentence.value: His father, Jozef Remek, was Lieutenant General of the Czechoslovak army (1973-75 deputy of the Minister of Defense responsible for air force and air defense, 1976-89 commander of the air force).
